title: Ferry Meadows Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Terry McKenna / River Nene at Ferry Meadows
images.caption: River Nene at Ferry Meadows. Ferry Meadows, Peterborough, is a beautiful country park set in the picturesque Nene Valley. The photograph was taken facing east, while standing on the edge of the Nene Way footpath.

images.title: Paul Shreeve / Visitors Centre, Ferry Meadows country park
images.caption: Visitors Centre

images.title: Paul Shreeve, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ferry Meadows Station, Nene Valley Railway

images.title: Terry McKenna / Sailing at Ferry Meadows, Peterborough
images.caption: Sailing at Ferry Meadows. Set in the Nene Valley, Ferry Meadows Country Park, Peterborough, is a popular leisure area with sailing enthusiasts, walkers, joggers and bird-watchers.

images.title: Tony Bennett / Lakeside Monument
images.caption: Lakeside Monument. This stone monument is situated on the lakeside at the park.

images.title: Katie / Cormorant trees
images.caption: Cormorant trees. The island on Overton Lake at the Country Park, is where local Cormorants go to rest and preen. The resulting guano can be seen on the right-hand side of the tree.

description: This super country park in Peterborough has several pretty lakes with cycling and walking trails running alongside the water's edge. There's also a stretch along the River Nene, several pretty meadows and peaceful woodland paths. Other attractions include a miniature railway and a pitch and putt golf course. The tracks are well surfaced and flat so its perfect for families looking for a safe cycle ride or walkers looking for an easy stroll. Ferry meadows is set within the larger area of Nene Park which also includes Thorpe Meadows with its Sculpture Park, riverside walks and a purpose built rowing lake. If you continue east through the park you'll also pass Orton Mere and Woodston Reach with more lakes and woodland to enjoy. Also nearby is the lovely Crown Lakes Country Park with waterside footpaths, meadows and woodland.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Peterborough Green Wheel Cycle Route passes through the park. The 20 mile circular trail explores the area around the city visiting the River Nene Way and the villages of Marholm and Etton. Also for cyclists National Cycle Route 63 runs through the park. It will take you through the heart of the National Forest from Burton on Trent to Wisbech. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cambridgeshire Walks page.

display_address: Ferry Hill, Castor, City of Peterborough, Cambridgeshire and Peterborough, England, PE6 7AG, United Kingdom
